results.firPara: • Wales qualifying for World Cup 2018 starts against Moldova on Monday
results.secPara: For Wales, there are so many memorable photos from Euro 2016, yet when it comes to the image that best captures the special relationship between the supporters and the players, Chris Gunters chin-up gesture after the defeat against England probably takes some beating. Daniel Sturridge had just scored a dramatic injury-time winner to break Wales hearts in Lens and Gunters first thought at the final whistle was to lift the spirits of the Red Wall at the other end of the stadium.
results.webTitle: Wales’ Chris Gunter: We will give everything to replicate Euro 2016 run

results.firPara: Sergio Agüero has been found guilty of violent conduct and will miss the derby with Manchester United on 10 September, the first match of a three-game ban.
results.secPara: Manchester City had appealed against the charge and argued that if the striker was found guilty he should receive less than a three-game ban because, they said, cases involving a greater degree of violence had met with that punishment.
results.webTitle: Sergio Agüero to miss Manchester derby after receiving three-match ban

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Spaghetti-spilling gesticulation, pen-pushers at City Hall, poor ol Diego Costa and a Ring of Fire

results.webTitle: Implicitly confirming that he is fun at parties

results.firPara: Yaya Touré has been left out of Manchester Citys Champions League squad by Pep Guardiola.
results.secPara: Touré has featured once this season, in Citys 1-0 win over Steaua Bucharest in the Champions League knockout round second leg. That game was virtually meaningless because City led 5-0 from the first leg.
results.webTitle: Yaya Touré left out of Manchester City’s Champions League squad

results.firPara: Crystal Palace are one of a quartet of clubs exploring the possibility of securing the former Arsenal midfielder Mathieu Flamini as the Frenchman seeks a new club following his release from the Emirates Stadium in June.
results.secPara: Flamini, who made 246 appearances over his two spells at Arsenal, and his representative have spoken to Palace, Roma, Olympiakos and another of the Frenchmans former clubs, Milan, over a potential full-time contract and is currently weighing up his options. Alan Pardew had made clear his desire to secure a replacement for the departed Mile Jedinak before Wednesdays transfer deadline, only for moves for Jack Wilshere, James McCarthy and Tomás Rincón to be scuppered at the last.
results.webTitle: Crystal Palace explore possibility of signing free agent Mathieu Flamini

results.firPara: Antonio Valencias late return from the international break may force José Mourinho into playing Phil Jones, Matteo Darmian or Timothy Fosu-Mensah at right-back for the Manchester derby despite none of the trio having played this season.
results.secPara: Valencia is away with Ecuador but does not return until next Friday, the day before Manchester Citys visit. The match is the early afternoon kick-off, further shortening the time Valencia has to recover, along with Argentinas Marcos Rojo and Sergio Romero, who are also expected late back.
results.webTitle: Antonio Valencia may return too late for Manchester derby, says José Mourinho
